alert.note: Alert for Matanuska Valley; Susitna Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 09 at 5:44PM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 PM AKDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Including the following areas, Matanuska Valley and Susitna Valley. * WHEN...Until 1245 PM AKDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...The Little Susitna River is expected to continue rising at the Parks Highway through Tuesday night. 4 to 6 inches of rain have fallen in the Talkeetna Mountains since Sunday evening. Little to no additional accumulation is expected overnight. The Little Susitna River at the Parks Highway rose into moderate flood stage at 1pm today and was was at 12.3 feet at 4pm and still rising slowly. Water levels are expected to continue to slowly rise into this evening and crest overnight. Additional rises of up to 6 inches are possible overnight. Numerous roads along the lower Little Susitna River were reported as flooded and impassable along with flooding impacting low lying properties in this area. The Upper Little Susitna River crested at 7.4 feet at the river river gage on the North Palmer Fishhook Rd. Numerous roads and low lying properties were reported to be flooding Monday night and Tuesday downstream from the Edgerton Parks Highway Bridge. The water level at the upper gage was 6.7 feet at 4pm. Water levels on the upper Little Susitna River should continue to recede overnight. Willow Creek at the Parks Highway crested at 11.7 feet at noon today. There were reports of flooding impacting numerous low lying roads and properties east of the Parks Highway. Water levels will continue to slowly recede along Willow Creek overnight. The Kashwitna River, Talkeetna River, Moose Creek and Susitna River are at or near bankfull. No flooding is expected along these rivers. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 529 PM AKDT, The Little Susitna River is expected to continue rising at the Parks Highway through Tuesday night. - For Little Susitna at Houston: At 4:00pm the stage was 12.31 feet. Flood Stage is 11.0 feet. Forecast: A crest of 12.6 feet is expected at 10:00pm Tuesday. For Little Su below Hatcher Pass Bridge: At 4:15pm the stage was 6.68 feet. Flood Stage is 6.5 feet. Forecast: A crest of 6.3 feet is expected at 10:00pm Tuesday. For Montana Creek near Talkeetna: At 4:15pm the stage was 11.67 feet. Flood Stage is 9.0 feet. Forecast: A crest of 6.6 feet is expected at 10:00pm Tuesday. For Susitna River near Sunshine: At 5:00pm the stage was 22.28 feet. Flood Stage is 24.5 feet. Forecast: A crest of 22.2 feet is expected at 10:00pm Tuesday. For Talkeetna River at the Talkeetna Railroad Bridge: At 4:00pm the stage was 12.01 feet. Flood Stage is 13.0 feet. For Talkeetna River Upstream of Talkeetna: At 4:45pm the stage was 9.28 feet. Flood Stage is 12.5 feet. Forecast: A crest of 9.0 feet is expected at 10:00pm Tuesday. For Willow Creek at Parks Highway: At 4:00pm the stage was 11.28 feet. Flood Stage is 10.0 feet. Forecast: A crest of 11.0 feet is expected at 10:00pm Tuesday. For Willow Creek near Willow: At 4:15pm the stage was 5.55 feet. Flood Stage is 5.9 feet. Forecast: A crest of 5.2 feet is expected at 10:00pm Tuesday. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
